intro: Allophylus letestui, commonly known as the Madagascar holly, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Sarcolaenaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
